PyKinectXEF.Playback.Load.VideoData(p_id)¶

PyKinectXEF.Playback.Player module¶

This module reads data from extracted video and skeleton data from the Kinect and plays it back to the user using PyGame.

The data can also be saved as an .avi file, useful for adding audio data -> A function to be added.

class PyKinectXEF.Playback.Player.KinectDataPlayer(performance_id, **kwargs)¶
close()¶

Closes and open modules / files etc

convert(*xy)¶

Converts an x,y value in original resolution to current frame size

Draws the body data at frame n

draw_label(text, size, xy, colour, offset=(0, 0))¶
draw_new_frame()¶

Clears the next frame to display

draw_skeleton(skeleton, time, colour)¶
draw_video(n)¶

Reads the next frame of video

entry_time(stream)¶

Returns the timestamp of the first occurence of data of the given stream

frame_time(t, stream)¶

Returns the frame number for data stream that occurs at time t

layers_to_draw()¶

Returns a list of streams being drawn, in order of background to foreground

static quitting()¶
ratio()¶

Returns the the % of change in size of frame

release()¶

Placeholder

run()¶

Plays the performance using real time ‘rendering’ in PyGame.

The program loops at 30fps and then uses the timestamp for each stream to decide whether or not to render the next frame

update()¶

Writes new frame to screen/file
